name: places/ChIJx2yM5whZwokRmBAz6QngmL8
formattedAddress: 232 E 30th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
adrFormatAddress: 232 E 30th St, New York, NY 10016, USA

originalText.text:
Office nice clean and spacious. Check in super efficient. Pre check quick. Dr. Ackert had file ready explained to me the process gave me a brief explanation how my insides work. Gave me an appointment. Off I went Total time 40 min perfect.
Thank you

text.text:

Thank you

originalText.text: Dr. Ackert is one of the kindest, most caring doctors I've ever had! Aside from making me feel very comfortable, he was extremely accommodating and competent-- he squeezed me in and performed a last-minute endoscopy on me that same day. Very grateful and would highly recommend!

text.text: Dr. Ackert is one of the kindest, most caring doctors I've ever had! Aside from making me feel very comfortable, he was extremely accommodating and competent-- he squeezed me in and performed a last-minute endoscopy on me that same day. Very grateful and would highly recommend!

originalText.text:
Dr. Ackert himself seems lovely, the one time I managed to meet him in person for an endoscopy. The problem is that his office is the most infuriating one I've had to deal with. I'm not a problem patient calling nonstop or requiring high-maintenance service, either.

Over the past 3 weeks, I was given the wrong procedure prep and had to figure that out on my own (and didn't get a call back until I emailed them), I had a pharmacy call me and tell me I had a prescription but the doc's office never told me what it was for and why (and I'm still trying to find out, but again, the office responds to no emails OR calls), and the only reason the endoscopy got scheduled to begin with is that my primary care physician works in a related practice and submitted the referral directly - I couldn't get an appointment by calling on my own because no one replied for days. I've never had a call *not* go to voicemail (and I've never gotten a call back after leaving a message).

I'm fed up, still in pain, and exhausted.

originalText.text: Excellent nurses, doctor, facility.  Ive had Dr. Ackert for my colonoscopies for 20 years.  On 2 occasions, I needed care before I could have the procedure.  I was brought to a bed, guven heated blankets, monitored, given a drip.  The procedure wasn't started until they were sure that my vitals were perfect. I highly recommend this doctor and facility.

originalText.text: Dr. Ackert was great! You see a lot of doctor's in your lifetime for numerous things, so it's great when you meet one who is so down to earth and passionate about his profession. Dr. Ackert got everything I needed done right away and already has me on track for a speedy recovery. Thaks Doc!
